com.poesys.accounting.db.account

Class AbstractAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.dto.AbstractDto
      • com.poesys.accounting.db.account.AbstractAccount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAccount, com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto, com.poesys.db.dto.IObserver, com.poesys.db.dto.ISubject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<com.poesys.db.dto.IDbDto>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Account

    public abstract class AbstractAccount
extends com.poesys.db.dto.AbstractDto
implements IAccount

    A data-access layer data-transfer object for the Account. This class is an abstract class that contains AndroMDA generated code; change nothing in this class. Instead, override any methods in the concrete subclass generated in the same package. AndroMDA will overwrite this class each time you run it but will never overwrite the concrete subclass.

    A division of the accounting system representing an individual accounting element; divided into assets, liabilities, and equity on the balance sheet or income or expense on the income statement; owned by an accounting entity

    Stereotypes:

    • CompositeKey
    • Persistent

    Class is read/write: true

    Author:
    Poesys/DB Cartridge
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • debitDefault

        private java.lang.Boolean debitDefault
        Nested property debitDefault

        whether the account transaction items default to a debit or credit item; chosen as the "usual" value for items in this account

        Added by AddLocalAttributeProperties Class is read/write: true Class is immutable: false Property is read/write: true Property is lazy: false

      • accountType

        private java.lang.String accountType
        Nested property accountType

        the kind of account:

        • Asset: a kind of property with a value owned by the accounting entity

        • Liability: a kind of debt owed by the accounting entity to another entity

        • Equity: a kind of fund invested by the accounting entity in the business; the difference between value of assets and value of liabilities

        • Income: revenues paid to the accounting entity

        • Expense: money paid by the accounting entity to another entity

        Added by AddLocalAttributeProperties Class is read/write: true Class is immutable: false Property is read/write: true Property is lazy: false

      • receivable

        private java.lang.Boolean receivable
        Nested property receivable

        whether this account is a receivable account, representing an asset that is a debt owed to the accounting entity

        Added by AddLocalAttributeProperties Class is read/write: true Class is immutable: false Property is read/write: true Property is lazy: false

        private java.lang.Boolean active

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractAccount

        public AbstractAccount()
        Create an empty Account for use in building a new object. The concrete subclass must call this constructor.

      • AbstractAccount

        public AbstractAccount(com.poesys.db.pk.IPrimaryKey key,
                       java.lang.String entityName,
                       java.lang.String accountName,
                       java.lang.String description,
                       java.lang.Boolean debitDefault,
                       java.lang.String accountType,
                       java.lang.Boolean receivable,
                       java.lang.Boolean active,
                       java.lang.String groupName)
        Create a Account. The concrete subclass must call this constructor.
        Parameters:
        key - the primary key of the Account
        entityName - composite super-key attribute that uniquely identifies child combined with child sub-key and any other parent super-keys
        accountName - the account name; unique within the entity
        description - text description of the nature of the account
        debitDefault - whether the account transaction items default to a debit or credit item; chosen as the "usual" value for items in this account
        accountType - the kind of account:
        • Asset: a kind of property with a value owned by the accounting entity
        • Liability: a kind of debt owed by the accounting entity to another entity
        • Equity: a kind of fund invested by the accounting entity in the business; the difference between value of assets and value of liabilities
        • Income: revenues paid to the accounting entity
        • Expense: money paid by the accounting entity to another entity
        receivable - whether this account is a receivable account, representing an asset that is a debt owed to the accounting entity
        active - whether the account is active at the present time.
        groupName - foreign key used by setter to query associated object

      • readObject

        private void readObject(java.io.ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Read an object from an input stream, de-serializing it. Each generated class must have this private method, which the deserialize method calls through Java reflection on the specific class. The class calls a shared code method to run the readObjectSetters.
        Parameters:
        in - the object input stream
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - when a nested object class can't be found
        IOException - when there is an IO problem reading the stream

        whether the account transaction items default to a debit or credit item; chosen as the "usual" value for items in this account

      • setAccountType

        public void setAccountType(java.lang.String accountType)
                    throws com.poesys.db.InvalidParametersException

        Set the accountType.

        • Read/Write DTO: true
        • Immutable DTO: false
        • Read/Write property: true
        • Immutable property: false
        • Lazy property: false (if true, proxy calls this method)

        the kind of account:

        • Asset: a kind of property with a value owned by the accounting entity

        • Liability: a kind of debt owed by the accounting entity to another entity

        • Equity: a kind of fund invested by the accounting entity in the business; the difference between value of assets and value of liabilities

        • Income: revenues paid to the accounting entity

        • Expense: money paid by the accounting entity to another entity

        Specified by:
        setAccountType in interface IAccount
        Parameters:
        accountType - the value with which to set the property
        Throws:
        com.poesys.db.InvalidParametersException - when the accountType value is null
